111.content:
Mummy- Sahara: Sees herself as a queen and claims to be rich in riches from her personal realm, but is constantly broke and requesting money from Bell. She's also always hungry which is odd for an undead.

Golem/Gauntlet- Earthaterra. (German like.) Has a Koneko (highschool dxd) like personality almost capable of reading Bell's thoughts and calling him a pervert when another woman is near by. She also enjoys sitting on his lap when hes resting.

Scallya- Nami Has a severe dislike for land and phobia to earth, so much so that she causes a flood of water to wash away the earth, making the dungeon room waist high in water. This often upsets Lilly and Welf.

Centaur- Cylla/Cyllara (Is like Caboose, but lusty. So a combination of Sister and Caboose. If you've ever seen Red Vs. Blue you know what Im talking about. Unintelligent, often hits her own allies and is turned on whenever she is touched by Bell in any way.)

Slime Girl- Tiialia/Tidia/Tiddie (Innocent little sister sterotype that says inappropriate things innocently.) She'll say things like Tiddie needs a good sucking when she wants to drink from the water bottle that Bell carries or wants to suck his sweat directly.

Lamia- Piper (Rattlesnake ish.) Feeling like a baby sitter of Bell's party members and sighs alot at having to have to take care of Bell's dead weights.

Werewolf- Scooter. Enjoys fighting and doing things for Bell, often desiring to make him happy. And expecting pets on the head from him. Often will chase after her own tail when not fighting monsters. Feels like she's in competition with Lilly as she sees fetching the magic stones as a game and gets rewards with head pats.

Alrune- Floret (French maid.) Has a french maid personality and wants to clean up after Bell while revealing her busty and lewd body. She often cleans up in front of him both to get his eyes to gaze at her and to clean up the area where he's going to walk, claiming that he shouldn't dirty himself by walking that far ahead.

Headless Knight- Maid Marian. Often will despense justice and make sure everyone is safe. If a pass parade ( when one party of adventurers passes a bunch of monsters to another) happens she'll slay the monsters as quick as she can and then chase after the dishonorable party.

Harpy- Aero. Loves to fly and only does things for Bell with the promise of sex later. She will try and have sex anywhere, but if often told that sex is in only in a hotel. She likes to have her breasts caressed by Bell and likes to caress him as she carries him in flight. Often trying to stroke him off through his pants.
111.title: Monster Girl Allies Names and Personality Traits

choices: Aiz, wants to see his new spell and could use the alone time with Bell
Lilly, would love to see his new spell and could use some extra coin
Welf, wow that's cool to hear
1111.content:
Bell waited patiently as he laid down on the sofa that was in the room under the church. He was laying face down with Hestia on his back updating his status.

Bell asked his goddess with a small smile, “So, what is my new status?”

Hestia was silent until she said to him, “It looks like you have gained a new spell."

Bell asked with a small smile of excitement trying to hold his giddiness inside, “What is this new skill like?”

“Summon.” That was Hestia’s reply void of any emotion other than shock. How could Bell be gaining so many unique abilities, skills and spells? This puzzled her very much.

With a small quick nod Hestia used her blood to update the hieroglyphs. Making his status update official. She had then had paper copied his Falna. After pulling the paper off his back she climbed off his back a she showed the paper to the sitting up Bell.

On the paper was the new status and new spell.

Level 2 Strength: D 578 Defense: D 500 Utility: F 356 Agility: E 499 Magic: G 271 Luck: H 187

Magic Firebolt- Swift Strike Magic Summon- Swift Assist Long Duration Magic

Skill Heroic Desire, Argonaut- Charges Automatically with Active Action

Bell was all sorts excited as he said to the Goddess, "Goddess, can I go try out this new spell. Please?"

Thinking about it with her index finger touching her chin she told him, "Only on the upper levels, I don't want you going past level five trying it out for the first time. After you tell me about it, then we'll see if you can use it past that."

Bell as a bit depressed by the answer, but decided to not show it. After all he did almost die a few days ago. Still, he couldn't wait to show off his new spell. He walked out of the church to find someone to show off his new spell to.

Who was the person he ran into?
1111.title: Bell gets a monster girl ally

11111.content:
Bell was walking down North Main heading south to get to the Babel Tower. Where the Dungeon was located at its base. He was wearing his new Pyonkichi Mk-IV which was made by Welf rather quickly yesterday. He had picked it up at the post office since Welf wanted to mail it saying he'd be out of commission on personal business. The silver and red armor went well with his black under clothing as usual. The main difference with this armor set was that he has his minotan daggers on his back now in back sheathes. In the left sheath was the shorter of the daggers Ushiwakamaru and in the right the longer dagger that was made just yesterday along side the armor thanks to Welfs new Forge ability Ushiwakamarunishiki. On the back of his waist above a square boxish potion pouch was the sheathe to his new baselard made from a drop item by the Baby Dragon from the eleventh floor Drahoine. And safely tucked into his left fore arm protecting light armor was a armor sheathe that housed the most treasured item of all, the Hestia Knife.

Bell closed his eyes as he thought to himself on what the possibilities of this new magic could be. Suddenly, he bumped into something that made him open his eyes and look up from the blue sweater tank top. The gold hair and eyes of Aiz Wallenstien who seemed rather silent and said to him with her stotic expression, "...Where are you off to Bell?"

Red flooded his face as Bell leaped back and bowed several times, "I'm sorry, so sorry Aiz. Please, forgive me."

Sullen by his shyness Aiz walked up and hugged his head into her breasts again, "...Please, don't apologize."

Just quivering and knees buckling Bell nearly fell down from the embarrassment. Disappointed she decided to stop making him so vulnerable and embarrassed. She released his head and said to him, “...So, what are you doing today?"

Bell then placed his fist into his hand as he told her with his embarrassment gone, "Oh, that's right. I just got a new magic that was going to try out today."

Aiz quickly said before he could escape based on his facial gestures, "I'm going with you."

Bell loss for words could only nod in defeat.
11111.title: Aiz, wants to see his new spell and could use t...

choices: Aiz is fascinated by this and wants to know more
The Dungeon summons a powerful monster
Bell's stomach growls the three go to the Hostess of Fertility
111111.content:
The Kenki stood back behind Bell and watched as he went in with his two minotan daggers, Ushiwakamaru and Ushiwakamarunishiki. Crimson slashes with sparks licking the blades crossed and jabbed the goblins. The white haired 'rabbit' boy with red eyes landed with a skid as he put his daggers away. Trying out his new magic he threw up his right hand, "Summon!"

The goblin looked at him expecting something, but nothing happened. Bell looked at his right hand and stuck out his left hand not thinking about it. He looked at his right hand as he said questioning, "Why didn't my Summon-"

From his left hand came a burst of green light. The light smashed through the dirt and stone as if formed into a seal. From the seal came out a small blonded haired girl ▼
https://67.media.tumblr.com/d1e2608654f1...
. Her hair was like that of pyrite and ruby red eyes. Her giant gauntlet fists went in and slammed into a goblin that made a dash for Bell.

The goblin crashed and turned into ash as the magic stone in it's chest broke. The golem girl looked stotically at Bell as she said to him, "Summoner."

Aiz looked at the girl and saw that the golem girl had several of her own traits and Bell's. She gave a slight smile with a faint blush as she said, "...She looks like our daughter."

Bell looked at Aiz as he said to her, "Uh?!"

His first thought was of if the golem girl was being nursed and then cared for by Aiz. And then Aiz was in an apron welcoming him home. The golem girl interrupted his thoughts by calling him out, "Summoner is a pervert."

Struck by the statement Bell lost his face. After regaining his face he then asked the golem girl, "So, uh, I'm Bell."

The golem girl replied to him, "I know that already, Summoner Bell. I am Earthaterra or Terra for short. I am your Golem and Gauntlet. Should anything need punching, I'm your summoning you want. The others wanted to come, but I assessed the situation and decided you needed my help. It would be more useful next time if you simply aim your left hand and called my name after saying Summon. Or you can call on any of your other summonings: Sahara, Nami, Cyllara, Tidialia, Piper, Aero, Scooter, Floret or Marian. Id suggest only summoning Cyllara if you need to make a quick reckless mistake."
111111.title: In the Dungeon

choices: Tione and Tiona the Amazon twins interupt
1111113.content:
Bell just looked at Terra as he then said to her, “Wow.”

His stomach then growled as he flushed and looked down at his stomach. Looking at all the goblin bodies he then said to the pair of girls, “Uh, with my Familia’s life savings given to the search party that took the request. I kinda am broke, so let me just collect these magic stones and drop items. And exchange them up in the Babel Tower’s Exchange and then we can go to lunch.”

Aiz then said as she pulled out a small knife, “I’ll assist in doing so. I am hungry as well.”

Aiz and Bell gutted twenty goblins as Bell looked at Terra and asked putting the last of the magic stones away, “So, why are you still here? Also, why don’t I feel more Mind Down symptoms while you are here?”

Terra explained as Aiz got her last goblin, “The spell is a low mind cost long duration swift assist magic. Meaning that the cost of the magic is relatively low per summoning you summon. And once we’re summoned our duration is based on how much energy we the summons have, so I won’t return til I choose to or am over thrown by fatigue. And we are a swift assist meaning that we need a single word to summon us.”

Aiz then said to Bell and Terra, “...I’m done, shall we go?”

The three went up to the surface and got on the Babel Tower elevators. It was a little cramped inside with Aiz having Bell in front of her. And the back of his head resting against her bosom.

Bell noticed that Terra rested her cheek against his groin. She rubbed her cheek on his zipper making him blush. He was completely still from the nuzzling that he felt from Terra. What happened next was almost worse, Aiz put her arms on his shoulders. And pulled him into her bosom tightly, then placed her nose in his hair.

The elevator opened and the three got out. Bell pulled himself away from the two girls and stumbled a bit. Panting he caught his breath as he then gained back his pale skin.

The three arrived at the exchange as Bell noticed Eina and said with realization, “It’s Tuesday, right? Miss Eina should be running the Babel Tower Exchange today.”

The woman heard her name as she said to Bell with a small smile, “Bell. I’m glad to see you are alright.”

Her eyes lids lowered as she said to him sternly, “What have I told you about not adventuring?”

Sighing she said to him pushing her glasses back up, “Never mind that, so, what do you have for me today?”

Aiz and Bell placed the two bags of magic stones on the counter. The tray was pulled behind the glass wall and the stones were counted. Eina placed several Valis into the tray and said to them slidding it back, “You have been given 4,000 Valis.”

A small bob of gold hair at Bell’s waist moved as Terra asked, “Summoner, is this the Ms. Eina that you think about for hours after visiting the Guild?”

Gasping Bell said to Terra, “Hey, stop reading my thoughts!”

Eina gawked as she stood up from her chair to look down at the short golem. She looked down at the golem and asked shocked, “Who is that Demiperson?”

Bell smiled nervously as he told her, “I learned a new magic called Summon. And I summoned Terra here. We’re going to get lunch now.”

Looking at her clock Eina said to the three, “Lunch is right now and I’ll be coming with you. I’d like to find out more about the summonings.”

Now with four in the group outing they arrived at the Hostess of Fertility. Syr smiled as she greeted them holding up her tray, “Hey, Bell, the usual table in the corner?”
1111113.title: Bell's stomach growls the three go to the H...

choices: "You must enjoy her sitting in your lap."
11111131.content:
"Yeah, that'll be fine," Bell said, nodding. He smiled at Syr, and she smiled back very widely.

Then Syr bowed and gestured for them to follow her. Modest endowments hung down within her blouse with the angling of her torso before she straightened back up, and Bell couldn't help looking.

Terra glanced up at him.

"Pervert," she deadpanned in a quiet voice.

"Uh, it's not like that..." Bell softly sputtered, his face going pink. "I don't know what you're talking about."

"Liar," said Terra. There was no heat in her tone, nor ice. It was merely a statement.

They followed Syr to the corner. Aiz walked on the other side of Terra, her eyes flitting down to the girl semi-frequently. Her expression was, like Terra's, difficult to read. Eina walked behind Bell and Terra, looking curiously down at the little demihuman. Syr glanced over her shoulder only once, when they had finally reached the table. She looked thoughtful and bemused at the sight of the golem girl.

They seated themselves at the table. Bell took a seat opposite Eina, and Aiz chose the seat next to him. Terra, without a moment's hesitation, seated herself squarely on Bell's lap. She did it in a very matter-of-fact way, too.

Syr looked amused at this.

"She's cute," the waitress commented, nodding to Terra. "How old is she? Twelve?"

"Twelve and a half," said Terra flatly. "Centuries."

Syr blinked. It was a testament to her professionalism that she did not especially react to this claim.

"I'm sure you are," she said in the kind of softly indulgent tone that one might use with a very small child. "Now, may I take your orders?"

Bell, Aiz, and Eina each placed their usual orders. Terra did not. She simply sat on Bell's lap, shifting now and then, resting the back of her head against his chest.

Syr left, and Eina turned to Bell, glancing curiously at Terra.

"So..." she began.
11111131.title: The Usual Table

111111312.content:
"You must really enjoy it, how that cute little girl is sitting in your lap."

Bell flushed at Eina's remark.

"It's not like that," he said. "She's..."

"Isn't it, Summoner?" said Terra, looking up at Bell with an inscrutable expression. She backed up a little. "But you're thinking differently. You wish Aiz and Eina were sitting on your lap, too. Pervert."

Though she said this, it did not seem at all like a remonstrance. She was simply stating a fact.

Eina quirked an eyebrow at Terra's remark, and at Bell's telling lack of a response.

"Is that so?" she said, looking at Bell half-amusedly. Privately she felt a little giddy at the thought, but it was easier to tease. "I wonder how she knows that, if it's really the case."

Bell did not look Eina in the eye.

"Uh... I'm not really sure, myself," he said. "It's n-not like I'm really thinking those kinds of things about you two!"

Eina could tell right away that this was a lie, and quite a feeble one, but Aiz seemed to believe it, judging by how her face imperceptibly fell.

"You aren't?" she said in a tone that was subtly disappointed.

Bell looked at her for a long moment. His face slowly lost some of its excess color.

"Well, maybe a little," he admitted shamefacedly.

Aiz perked right up at this, although again it would have been difficult for a casual observer to tell.

Terra cocked her head.

"Those two want to sit in your lap, too, Summoner," she said, glancing from Aiz to Eina. "I don't want to let them, though."

Now it was Eina's turn to blush and abashedly avert her eyes. Aiz simply nodded a quiet confirmation, as if this was perfectly normal.

"Guh..." muttered Eina, looking very red indeed. "What are you, girl, a mind-reader?"

Bluntly, Terra answered.
111111312.title: "You must enjoy her sitting in your lap."

choices: Let's look at what Aiz and Terra are doing.
Continue with this part, who is the mummy?
1111113123.content:
As per her now established stotic blunt and matter of factly personality Terra deadpanned to Eina, "No, not quite. I am a demihuman summoning known as a golem. We are made with one face and one face only. Humans and other humanoids plus some other species of demihumans were made with many faces. It is easy to read the faces of humans because there are so many. With constant observation of my stotic face, I can gather all details of your current face. Even Aiz is easy to read. Though among humans she is the toughest to read of you all. With a golem it is impossible to read their face. If I met another golem, I would observe that golem single face. If they were a happy face then they'd be excited at all times and unpredictable, because they'd only do more and more excited things to maintain their happy face. With my face, of being stotic, I shall always be matter of factly and dead pan. If I exhibit an unusual emotion it could very well cause a crack and any small crack will lead to bigger cracks. And those cracks lead to broken pieces of this body. And that would be dangerous for master."

Bell looked sad as he was about to say something to him when Terra interrupted him seeing a tear and almost quivering that went unnoticed by everyone but Aiz who noticed a small crack appear on her neck, "Master, please no tears. I erode easily."

Bell sniffed as he then wiped his eye and said to her, "Right, right."

Shifting her neck Terra felt her crack and maintained her same stotic behavior. She then looked to Eina, Aiz and back at Bell. Terra then asked Aiz, "Aiz, would you mind escorting me to the ladies room? I require to powder my nose as they say."

Although Aiz didn't look or seem it, she did apply a little bit of make up and knew the phrase. She nodded as she pushed her seat out and stood up. She then walked behind Terra as the pair went off. Leaving and Bell and Eina alone with each other.

Eina then asked him looking at him, "So, how did you summon such a lovely little girl?"

Bell tried to recall the events as he moved his left hand forward unconsciously, "Well, I threw my right hand out trying to do my new magic. But, it didn't work. And when I put my left hand out by accident and said Summon-"

Suddenly brown lightning birthed forth from the outstretched left hand and at the seat right beside Eina. From the lightning came a sandy brown fleshed girl with black hair ▼
https://65.media.tumblr.com/47c42ec558ac...
. Her sand gold eyes looked at the food that was placed down by Syr. Syr made an surprised 'ooo' sound as the bandaged covered mummy girl said pointing at the plate with a smile, "Oh, is that food? I hope you don't mind if I have some."

She then grabbed Eina's ramen and poured the hot liquid down her maw. Eina just starred slack jawed as her left eye twitched.
1111113123.title: No, not quite

choices: Tione and Tiona the Amazon twins see Aiz and think Terra is her daughter!
11111131231.content:
Terra held her neck as still as possible as Aiz took some sand paper to her neck. She grinded the stone made girl's neck until until the heat made the clay near liquid again. The clay was arranged to cover the crack and repair it. Terra thanked Aiz with her usual stotic face, "Thank you Aiz. It is troublesome to maintain one's body because of irrational fears such as erosion."

Aiz felt sorry for the demihuman that looked like a future child of hers and Bells. She wrapped her arms around Terra from behind the short two and a half feet tall golem. Showing an unusual amount of humanity Aiz said to the golem with a slight smile, "You will never crack while I am here. Understand this."

Terra knew that her neck was still drying and said looking straight forward in her usual deadpan style, "I can't look up at your smile, but I would like to make your smile even bigger. I may be twelve and a half centuries old, but golems are made of magic clay. And when we are contracted with a new summoner. We are reduced to a fresh pile hot clay. Clay that is arranged by the dreams of our new summoner. If it pleases you, I am the image of what Summoner envisions his future daughter would look like if you and he ended up making off spring."

Aiz widen her eyes as she let out a small gasp. A smile that was unusually long came to her face and her eyes closed in happiness. A giddy feeling rushed in her as she quivered in happiness. The giddiness calmed and receded like a wave.

Terra then said to Aiz, "Shall we go and rejoin Summoner?"

Aiz smiled still and said as they left, "Yes, let's go rejoin your father."
11111131231.title: Let's look at what Aiz and Terra are doing.

choices: Sahara over reacts and shouts that she'll eat if she wants to
Eina asks tries to make new conversation
Sahara is refined enough to let Bell and the others eat their new plates of food
111111312311.content:
Bell looked at the mummy who just ate his and Aiz's food. She didn't even bother chewing the rice with mushrooms from Bell's plate. She did cut up Aiz's steak and consume it with fevor. Terra didn't even look still aware of her neck and said to the mummy, "Sahara, stop eating everything. Summoner doesn't have that much money."

Sahara wiped her lips with a bandage in a very lady like manner, which was odd cause she just ate everything like a boar. Closing her eyes and acting rather refined like a queen, "Of course, Lady Terra. Master Bell, I have forgotten my manners. I am Sahara, the mummy summoning."

Terra sat back down in Bell's lap and pulled his arms around her waist. She said explaining to the slack jawed Eina, "Sahara is undead and because she died of starvation she is constantly hungry. Summoner must have summoned her by accident explaining how he summoned me."

Sahara looked at Syr as she said to her, "Oh, which reminds me. Do you have any more food? Or wine? I'll eat and drink anything."

Eina asked questioningly, "But, how is she not full?"

Sahara looked at Eina she said to her resuming her regal manner that she had broken out of character asking Syr about food, "Being undead has it's benefits. Such as not gaining an ounce of fat. Having many scarabs in my body prevents the food from needing to be emptied out."

From Sahara's belly came a few scarabs from under bandages. The scarabs walked around the table scaring Syr. Syr pointed at them saying, "Can you please recede your bugs?"

Lyu walked up as she said holding new plates of food, "Momma Mia says that the new girl doesn't get any more food."
111111312311.title: And now we meet Sahara

1111113123113.content:
For a moment, it looked like Sahara was about to throw a tantrum. Her face contorted and she tensed up like a tightly coiled spring. But then she took a slow, deep breath and relaxed, easing her body and calming her expression. With a sovereign mastery of her demeanor she nodded and waved this away, taking it with apparent good humor.

"Is she afraid I'll eat her out of house and home?" the dusky-skinned mummy lightly inquired as Lyu set the new plates of food before the others.

"Mm," Lyu hummed, an uninvested and noncommittal response. "I didn't ask. But your little friends are unsanitary." She gestured to where one of Sahara's scarabs scittered across the table. "Do try not to let them out."

"Of course," said Sahara, but her face twitched a little. "They might be sacred creatures, but if you think they're unsanitary..."

Bell interjected before anything could be said that might later be regretted.

"So, you're a mummy," he said. "And another summon? How many are there?"

Sahara inclined her head, looking at Bell with a gracious expression.

"For you, master? There are ten of us."

Syr made an impressed "Oh!" sort of sound. Lyu cocked her head.

"Ten?" said Aiz, swallowing a mouthful of meat pie. "That's a good-sized party.Two times more than the whole rest of Hestia Familia, isn't it?"

"Summoner can't have us all out at once, though," Terra remarked, giving Sahara a blank look that somehow managed to convey a whole world of emotion. The mummy smiled right back at the golem in a faux gracious manner.

"Right, but of course," said the dark haired, bandaged beauty. "The number and duration are restricted by his level of magic, naturally. At most, at present, I guess he'd be able to summon three of us at a time. But even just one summon as noble and distinguished as myself is worth a whole army of lesser mortals," she added a touch airily.

Bell finished his food with a contented sigh, smiling gratefully at Syr and Lyu. The former blushed but returned the smile. The latter inclined her head and afforded him something that might have been a small, subtle grin.

"Thanks for the free seconds," Bell said.

Syr giggled.
1111113123113.title: Sahara Maintains Her Dignity

choices: She assumes Terra is Aiz and Bell's daughter
She recognizes Terra as a golem and a summon
She is struck by a pervy big-sister type infatuation with Terra
11111131231133.content:
"Aiz, my daaaarling~!" came a sudden, drunken cry.

There was a slight commotion as Lyu ducked aside and Syr was nearly bowled over. Eina watched bemusedly, Sahara interestedly, and Bell abashedly as the petite form of the redheaded goddess of chaos, mischief, and the hearth, Loki, came barreling at them and threw herself at Aiz in a sodden glomp.

The blonde herself did not particularly react, not even though Loki buried her face in her chest and quite publicly nuzzled her bosom.

"Hello," she said to Loki, outwardly unperturbed.

"Aiiiiz!" Loki gushed. "Where weeere you? Don't leave me all alone, you awful girl!"

Bell tried not to stare at the way Aiz's breasts rolled and mashed with the press of Loki's rosy cheeks.

Eina watched with a kind of vaguely morbid fascination as the clearly intoxicated goddess showered kisses on the Kenki. Sahara clapped as if entertained by the spectacle. Syr sheepishly averted her eyes, and Lyu watched unfazed.

Terra quietly stared.

Loki continued snuggling Aiz for a few moments longer before finally raising her face from the blonde's bosom. Squinting, vulpine eyes fell upon Terra.

A beat.

Loki stared at the thirty inch tall golem with her golden hair and striking red eyes. She blinked, and looked up to see the girl was sitting in Bell's lap. Bell who was sitting next to Aiz. With a girl in his who looked like she could have been his and Aiz's illegitimate daughter.

Through the spinning of her head, Loki latched onto this with a sense of something not unlike revelation.

She looked again at Terra. Then at Bell. Then at Aiz.

Sahara quirked an eyebrow, bemused by the redhead's actions. Eina shrank a little nervously in her seat. Syr was hesitantly backing away. Only Lyu looked unbothered by the look in Loki's eyes.

And Loki herself stood up to her full, diminutive height and crossed her arms over her flat chest, expression unreadable.
11111131231133.title: Loki barges in

choices: Terra interjects and corrects the matter
Syr protests this with a blush
Loki snaps and turns on Bell
111111312311331.content:
"When did you two have a kid?" Loki said, turning a baleful eye on Bell. The room temperature dropped by several degrees.

"Eh? No, she's not--"

"She just arrived today," said Aiz in complete seriousness, addressing the goddess.

Loki pulled a face that was hard to read, and she stepped backwards as if flinching from a strike.

"J-Just today?!" said the goddess. She muttered, looking troubled. "You were pregnant and I didn't notice? I'm slipping up... and sheesh, I know human life cycles are really quick compared to our own, but do your babies usually grow this fast...?"

Eina sweatdropped. Bell looked bewildered. Aiz seemed faintly amused.

"Oh, yes," said the Kenki blithely. "Terra here is a perfect mix of Bell and myself."

Loki grimaced, and she looked uncertainly at Terra.

"Hnng... I can see the resemblance, yeah," she said. "She's definitely got his rabbity looks."

'Rabbity?' thought Bell.

"I think there's a misunderstanding here," said Eina. "Terra isn't Aiz and Bell's child."

Loki turned on Eina with a skeptical look.

"Do you really expect me to believe that?" she said, gesturing to Terra. "Just LOOK at her!"

"Um, yes," said Eina, perplexed and a little uncertain. "Er, it's the truth. Sahara-san, could you explain?"

The mummy looked up from Eina's plate, which she had swiped and emptied during the half-elf's brief exchange. Her mouth still full with the last of Eina's meal, she grinned cheekily, a mischievous gleam in her eyes.

"Well, when a man and a woman love each other very much..." she began.
111111312311331.title: She assumes Terra is Aiz and Bell's daughter

choices: Aiz offers to cover it in exchange for a favor
1111113123113312.content:
"Don't lie, Sahara!" said Syr, her face very pink. "Aiz and Bell-kun haven't... er, they don't have any children. They're not even dating."

She paused at this, collecting herself, and sent a curious look at the pair as if to say You AREN'T, right?

Bell sputtered, but he nodded in the affirmative. Aiz confirmed this as well a moment later, her expression a tad sullen.

Loki seemed to deflate, though she still looked at Terra a little suspiciously.

"So you say... but if that's the case, then whose kid is she?"

"No one's," said the blonde. "I'm a summon."

Loki blinked.

"A summon," the goddess parroted, as if testing the word out on her tongue. "Oh. Okay. So that means..." She turned, her expression bright and enthusiastic once more. "...my lovely Aiz is still pure and unsullied!"

And with this exclamation the goddess once more sprang at Aiz. But this time the blonde ducked, and instead of glomping her favorite human's chest Loki was propelled by her leap straight past to Bell and Terra. Her body knocked the golem out of Bell's lap, and she landed with her face planted squarely between the adventurer's legs.

There was a long, pregnant silence. Bell looked down at Loki, his face as red as the goddess's hair, his body tense as a bowstring drawn nigh to snapping. Loki was stock still, as if frozen by mortification, her shorts-clad posterior sticking up comically in the air.

Then a massive stone fist threw Loki bodily through the table, smashing it and sending their dishes crashing down. Terra, the crack in her neck reopened and widened by an almost worrying degree, moved herself back into Bell's lap, her face once more impassive.

Lyu looked down at the wreckage caused by the diminutive summon's sudden attack, and at the unconscious form of the goddess, Loki.

"You know you'll have to pay for that, right?" said the retired adventurer. Syr nodded.

Bell paled.

"Er... how much?" he asked worriedly, his recent earnings suddenly seeming very insubstantial.
1111113123113312.title: Syr protests this with a blush

11111131231133122.content:
Lyu looked at Bell as she said to him, "Searching for you was a favor to Syr. Vouching for you about Lord Hermes's peeping was a favor to you. You can repay that favor with either a date with Syr or paying the table?"

The aforementioned waitress let out a surprised meep as she blushed. She looked at Bell and gave him a puppy dog pout. And just like a house made of straw, he fell down, "Uh, a date will do."

Syr's face became the very definition of a rose. Chloe the cat animal person meowed as she could practically see the steam coming out of Syr's ears. Chloe smiled as she then said landing on Syr's back, "Oh, is meow going on a daaate!"

Lyu shot a glare at Chloe as she leaped back with an eep. Aiz looked at Syr and then at Terra. She stood up looking at Bell, "...Bell, date me as well."

His eyes wide Bell gains a red face and Sahara smiles bemusedly, "Oh, master, such the player."

Terra said matter of factly, "Summoner will not be sleeping peacefully. He will be dreaming of all the girls."

With Syr running to the ladies room to collect herself Aiz returned to her seat. Eina asked after looking at the watch, "So, what are the other summonings?"

Sahara sighed disappointed that all the romance was over with now, "Honestly, it's not our place to reveal the summonings other than their names. But, what I can tell you is. That we were created by the minor god Okayado. The god that created us did so to create a popular hero. The popular hero was named Kimihito and had six popular summons. And we are his failures."

Bell had shock come to his face. Sahara laughed as she then said to him, "Well, looks like we need to go."

Terra said rather matter of factly, "We are being called back. The others are upset at us. We'll be back soon."

The pair popped into clouds of smoke. Bell coughed as he said looking for them, "Where did they go?"

Aiz stated something that shocked him, "...Do often think of what our future child would look like?"
11111131231133122.title: Lyu says, "A date with Syr."

Bell replied rather embarrassed with a red face, "Uh, I can't answer that!"

Bell dropped his bag of valis as he ran out of the Hostess of Fertility. Aiz looked a bit sad, but remember Terra's words. She knew that Bell liked her and for now that was enough. Besides, she had a date with him to prepare for.

Eina picked up the valis bag as she said to Aiz, "As his advisor, I'll return this to him. I hope that your date goes well."

Aiz looked at Eina before she opened her mouth, "...I too hope that your date with him goes well when it happens. I'll request Tione and Tiona's help in picking something out nice for the date."

----In the back with Mia----

Mia spied on the situation as she then wrote in a magic book the events. The page had the ink disappear and have ink appear soon after. Excellent, my little rabbit is going to be well entertained. And hopefully, he'll only grow brighter. I am intrigued by this new magic, find out more.- F.

----At the Guild----

Eina was called into her superior's office. Eina reported as a member of the guild. The superior was a black lab animal person. His ears perked up and then flopped down as he said clearing his throat while holding the papers of Bell Cranell's file, "Eina, the record holder is becoming more and more interesting. It currently is in the guild's best interest to have him be direct contracted and chronicled. His own accounts and the accounts of others can no longer hold up his file. We smell something fishy going on. And so, we are directing you to be apart of the Hestia Familia."

Eina gasped as she looked at the papers placed in front of her. Her superior told her looking straight into her eyes as calmly as he could, "From today onward you are a Chronicler and Dungeon Advisor with field duty. Meaning, you will be going into the dungeon."

Eina looked somewhat fearful as she then calmed herself. She pulled the paper up as she said to the man, "Understood. And these papers will make sure I get a Falna from Hestia?"

Her superior gave a short nod, "Yes, if she refuses then she'll have to pay the entire debt of 30,000 valis she owes Hephaestus and she'll have to face having Bell Cranell being black listed. If she wishes to avoid these things, she'll have to give you a falna."

Eina did not feel comfortable with this, but these were orders from the Guild. She walked out of the office and arrived at the Hestia Familia's house. She held her breath as she knocked on the secret door under the church.
111111312311331221.title: Uh, I can't answer that!

But, at the same time, the very threats she was getting were making her worried. And the papers did mention that her main job would be to observe Bell for whoever was mysteriously pulling the strings. But, try not to swing those sweater puppies in my face. Just cause you are a bit bigger than me, doesn't mean you have to show off."

Blushing at her new goddess's unusual mannerisms Eina did as she was told. Eina laid on Hestia's bed with her tatas resting on the mattress. Her back exposed to the small goddess, she felt the ichor drip on her back.

Hestia placed a paper on Eina's back. Pulling the paper off she hands the paper and glasses to the half elf. Eina looked at the paper as she read it to herself.


Level 1 Strength: I 0 Defense: I 0 Utility: I 0 Agility: I 0 Magic: I 0

Magic []

Skill Healers Desire, Hippocrates- Healing Touch when emotion is devotion

Eina asked curious, "I already have a skill? Really?"

Hestia shrugged her shoulders as she told the older half elf, "What can I say, you are in my Familia. You all some how start with a skill. I mean, forget I said anything."

Hestia threw her arms down as she said to her, "Now, be happy that you are a child in my Familia now. But, don't think that you can hog Bell. He is my child and my child only. Understand?"

Did Eina tell Hestia about Aiz and Syr's dates?

"Does that include, uh, dating?" Eina asked somewhat hesitantly. Her breasts mashed beneath her, and she shivered as the Falna sent new sensations through her body.

"Especially dating," said Hestia sharply. "Why? You aren't planning to seduce him, are you?"

She said this with more seriousness than jest, and Eina winced.

"N-No," she replied, not a lie but not entirely the truth, either. "But, er... well, he is his own person, after all. If a girl asks him out..."

Hestia frowned.

"Who asked him out?"

"No one," Eina said a little too quickly.

Hestia was silent. She pressed her knees into Eina's sides, causing the half-elf to wince. Her chest felt squashed and she was having a little trouble breathing with Hestia atop her.

"Okay," Eina said, a little stressed. "So maybe he has dates with Syr and Aiz. But the first is just to pay for damages at the Hostess of Fertility, and the second... well, er."

Hestia did not lose her temper as Eina would have expected. She did not declaim or curse or sulk. Instead, Hestia patted her on the back like a dog that had fetched its master's slippers and earned a little praise. Eina blushed at this imagery and tried to pretend she hadn't thought that.

"I see," said Hestia in a thoughtful tone. "Thank you for telling me that. That deserves a treat."

"Um... should I ask what sort?"

"Not if you don't want me to spoil the surprise."

Despite herself Eina thought of several absurd possibilities, many of them distinctly erotic in nature. Lying here, topless, with Hestia on her back was giving her all kinds of crazy ideas.

Hestia, for her part, was deep in thought of what to do about Bell's dates.

11111131231133122111222.title: She decides to stick with her original plan

111111312311331221112221.content:
Bell drifted quickly off to sleep, seated at the kitchen table. It was dark and quiet and he felt enormously exhausted. His head was hazy and he felt faint and leaden with weariness.

He dozed off. He slept.

Until suddenly he realized, bleary and stupid-feeling in the aftermath of waking, perceiving a sudden soft weight on his lap and a strong case of morning wood, that he had been woken up by someone sitting on his lap.

It was dark still, but in an early morning sort of way, and if he squinted he just make out the modestly curvy form of a certain familiar half elf frozen stiff in sudden understanding of where she had just sat and what that stiff thing poking her backside was.

"Eina?" said Bell drowsily. "Why are you sitting on my lap?"

Eina was silent. Even through the gloom he could see the erubescent glow of her cheeks. Finally she answered.

"I didn't see you."

"Oh," said Bell weakly. There was a pause. "Are you--?"

Embarrassed Eina swiftly rose from Bell's lap.

"I hope you have fun on your dates." She blurted this out.

Bell stared, perplexed. This was an incongruous thing to say, he thought. Especially after she had just been sitting on his lap, a glass of juice spilled on the table in her initial shock at feeling a body and a rigid, throbbing rod underneath her.

"Um, thanks?"

"It's not like Hestia has asked me to supervise your dates. I d-don't plan on interfering," she said in an emphatically, falsely cheerful voice.

Bell blinked. Eina was beet red and avoiding his eye. He got the impression now that this wasn't just because his pecker had been rising to greet the morning beneath her fully covered full moon.

A beat.

"Okay," Bell said. That's... uh... nice of you."

Eina blushed harder.

"I'm sorry," she said. "I told Hestia about your dates and now she's telling me tochaperone you. I've ruined your dates before they've even started, haven't I?"

Bell thought for a moment before answering.
111111312311331221112221.title: Eina's Embarrassment

Eina perplexed by this went and sat in a third guest chair that the Hestia Familia had in case of Lilly visited. She began to eat her waffles with steamed broccoli and side of boiled egg. She listened to him choosing that maybe he just needed someone to listen. Bell told her focusing on the table cloth's white floor pattern, "When Aiz asked me out, I felt a grip in my chest. I was nervous. And it might help to have an acquaintance there to help make sure we are safe. I'd hate for the attention I've attracted to be bothersome for her. After what Mord did in Rivira I don't seem to trust most of the adventurers."

Bell looked up as he asked her confused, "Wait, why are you here this early? And why are you here at all?"

Eina had to admit to herself that she was a bit sullen that she didn't get welcomed by Bell. But, she supposed from his point of view, this was the home of him and the goddess. No one else was allowed here unless if they joined the Familia. And that thought brought a smile to her lips as she said deciding to hold back the info of watching him to herself, "I'm a member of the Familia, Bell. I'm your new healer!"

Eina told Bell with a small smirk, “Well, I was worried about you in the Dungeon going on adventures all the time. And if I remember correctly, I tell you all the time. That Adventurers shouldn’t have adventures. And you’ve been going on adventures ever since I can remember five months ago. All and all, I’m joining to make sure you don’t have any adventures.”

Bell sweat dropped as he gave a nervous chuckle, “Yeah, it’s not like I did it on purpose. I’m just trying to catch up to my idol.”

Bell frowned, bemused.

"Well, I'd just been telling Eina that we should go into the dungeon and get her some equipment..." he said, shrugging vaguely.

"The guild desk clerk?" said Lilly, perplexed.

"My advisor," Bell said. "Formerly. But she's a member of Hestia Familia now. A healer, apparently."

Lilly cocked her head, the expression seeming most adorably canine with her disguise.

The first level of the dungeon was safest, with Eina's low status and almost zero equipment. A few rookies looked in awe at THE Rookie as he and Lilly easily dispatched the weak monsters inhabiting the level.

The young adventurers all looked at Bell with admiration and even awe. There were a couple girls whom he rescued in such a manner, but he hardly seemed to notice their blushingly spoken thanks.
